Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
I was scrolling through my facebook feed and I saw a post by Mr.Randeep Hooda. He is a well known Bollywood actor.

Here's his facebook post:

If you are Muslim and suddenly start feeling unsafe in country where you lived for more than thousand years..

If you are Dalit and start feeling insulted on every moment of life..

If you are Hindu and suddenly start feeling that cows are being slaughtered everywhere...

If you are a Jain and suddenly start feeling that your religious piety is being compromised...

If you are punjabi and think all the youth are on drugs.

Just do one thing...

- Stay away from social media...

- Don't watch news...

- Stay away from debates on

religion...

Just look around you at your friends who belong to different castes , communities and religions...

And you will find that you are living in one of the best countries in the world!!

This is the best thing I read today…

Image source: Instagram post by Randeep Hooda • Dec 2, 2016 at 9:50am UTC

Questions: What interesting thing did you read today?
Answers:
When China refused to share technology with India-

Bundelkhand region of Uttar Pradesh is dealing with severe water crisis. It receives lowest rainfall and underground water levels are at all time low with Mahoba being the most parched district. So Uttar Pradesh government decided to moisten the ground by inducing rain artificially.

But India doesn't have such technology so they contacted pioneer of this technology, their neighbour cum rival, China. According to Dharampal Singh, State irrigation minister, “China had offered to share the process with us for about Rs 10.5 crore but for reasons best known to them, they backed out in February this year. We even asked them to participate in a global tender but they didn’t.”

After China turned their back IIT Kanpur was asked to undertake the project. The process, known as cloud seeding, involves spraying a mixture in atmosphere around which water vapours condense and when these water droplets become too heavy to stay in air they fall down as rain. Development of this mixture was the most difficult part of the project but IIT Kanpur in collaboration with department of aerospace engineering, civil engineering and bio engineering developed it in just five months. In IIT Kanpur’s deputy director Manindra Agarwal’s words “The mixture is most critical part and we have perfected it. The rest of the technology is quite standard.”

Also the estimated cost of inducing artificial rain over 1000 square kilometre using the IIT Kanpur technique would come to around Rs 5 crore.

Once America and now China…never underestimate the power of Indian scientists.

Source- https://m.timesofindia.com/home/education/news/iit-kanpur-develops-tech-to-make-artificial-rain-minister/articleshow/64863548.cms

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
I'm pretty sure most of you here know Nicki Minaj. She's an American singer/rapper.

And I'm pretty sure most of you hate her as well. She's not exactly known for all the good reasons. I used to hate her too but then she did something that just forced me to change.

I think this deserves respect. A LOT of respect.

So it all started when a fan replied to her tweet and asked if she wanted to pay his tuition fees.

And then Nicki Minaj replied. (I’m pretty sure he didn't expect it)

And then she actually did setup a contest, helping over 50 of her fans. Sure, she probably has a lot of money, but it takes some massive generosity to help her fans like this.

Here's something she posted on Instagram after:

She spent over $50,000 dollars on that day. She has actually started a student charity that's constantly helping students around the world for the past one month or so.

I'm actually astonished by how a social image can be deceptive. She's known for twerking among other things and her songs all portray her in some sort of bad light.

But to see this was truly astounding.

And today, Nicki Minaj, you've earned my respect.

Edit: Ketan Pande, down in the comments, has just informed me that Nicki Minaj has been secretly helping a Village in India! Thanks Ketan!

Nicki Minaj Quietly Kept Sending Funds To An Indian Village, Today It's Fully Developed

Questions: What interesting thing did you read today?
Answers:
People with perfect eyesight you want to see how we, people with glasses see the world without their glasses? Here’s something by Philip Barlow Studio
.

I have got Glasses and without these I’m practically blind. Whenever I talk to someone without my Glasses on, the person is just a humanoid shape in front of me and his voice tells me that who I’m talking to.

Edit: As everyone is asking how these pictures were taken— these are not pictures, these are Oil paintings by Philip Barlow.

See ya!

Gauri Mishra

Questions: While reading books, I get struck with difficult words. What should I do?
Answers:
(Image source: Web)

I'd suggest you to do what Shashi Tharoor did in his reading strategy. You cannot always look into a dictionary, or search for the word in web to find its meaning. This genius, never looked for a word's meaning in dictionary. In an interview he explained that you'd naturally learn the meaning of a new word once you see them couple of times in different sentences. So, simply register the word, assume word meaning in the context and continue reading. Gradually, you will figure out its true meaning. Otherwise you might end up losing a lot of time searching for meanings of words. Happy reading!!

(Thank you for all the views. Since the answer is reaching more readers, I thought it's my responsibility to mention that I was answering the very question. I never meant to say it is “the best reading strategy”. It is the strategy that you can employ if you feel struck by unknown words. There is no absolute right way of reading. Whatever works for you, is the best strategy for you!)

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
50 tough bikers escort a bullied student to school.

11-year-old Phil Mick a sixth-grade student of DeKalb Middle School, Indiana (USA) was a victim of intense bullying. It eroded the kid’s self-esteem so badly that he wanted to kill himself. The Auburn teen’s plight somehow reached the ears of a bikers group in the area and they decided to boost the boy’s confidence.

On Phil’s first day of sixth grade on August 1, more than 50 bikers from Fort Wayne and Columbia City gathered at Richards Restaurant in Auburn to escort the harried kid to school. The bikers prayed for Phil before hitting the road to reach the school.

The motorcycles’ roar was difficult to miss as they arrived at the school. Fellow students rushed out to see as sound of the mean machines reverberated off the brick walls of the school. It was a sight to behold as young Phil stepped out in full grandeur, his confidence touching sky-high.

Young Phil later said that he is not afraid any more.

A first day of school the sixth-grader will not forget.

Questions: Which are the best sarcastic lines in the Harry Potter series?
Answers:
"My grandmother thinks Charms is a soft option," mumbled Neville.
"Take Charms," said Professor McGonagall, "and I shall drop Augusta a line reminding her that just because she failed her Charms O.W.L., the subject is not necessarily worthless."
"We teachers are rather good at magic, you know.”
"Now, the Vanishing Spell –"
"Hem, hem."
"I wonder," said Professor McGonagall in cold fury, turning on Professor Umbridge, "how you expect to gain an idea of my usual teaching methods if you continue to interrupt me? You see, I do not generally permit people to talk when I am talking."
"I – I didn't think –"
"That," said Professor McGonagall, "is obvious."

-Minerva McGonagall

Oh, how I love that woman.

Questions: Why should we read books?
Answers:
Let me keep it simple.

Have you read Think and Grow Rich by Napoleon Hill?

Pages: 176

Wordcount: 89,175

An average person with a reading speed of 250 WPM can finish reading this book in 6 hours.

But it took 20 years for the author to research and to finish the book.

I think you can understand now. You can almost gain the knowledge and experiences of a person who made researches for 20 years in just 6 hours.

Whenever you read a good book, somewhere in the world a door opens to allow in more light.

–Vera Nazarian

Happy reading!

Questions: What's the best life lesson you've ever learned from a fictional character?
Answers:
Rachel Green: It takes courage to leave all luxuries behind and stand up on your two feet.
Daenerys Targeryen: In order to make others believe you are a Queen, first you, yourself, have to believe you are one.
Tyler Durden: You are more than your belongings. You are the all singing, all dancing crap of the world.
Walter White: Be terrifically unbeatable at whatever you do.
Cersei Lannister: You should be a lioness. Calmly ferocious.
Margaery Tyrell: Always play the right cards with the right people.
Ross Geller: A few bad experiences should never make you give up on love.
Phoebe Buffay: Terrible circumstances from our past shouldn’t stop us from seeing the beauty in life.
Monica Geller: At times, you need to choose what you ought to do and not what you want to do even when your heart is crying inside.
Chandler Bing: It’s okay to start from the bottom of something you love to do than to keep doing a job that you hate.
And the biggest lesson:
Joey Tribbiani: It is wise to never share food.

(Image source: Google Images)

Questions: What bothers you about the Harry Potter books?
Answers:
Sirius never knew how the Dursleys treated Harry, how they acted as if he was hardly human.

Even in their earliest conversations, Sirius assumes Harry would rather go back to his relatives.

Harry never tells him.

When Harry comes to Grimmauld Place at the start of the fifth book, he is frustrated. His friends, the closest thing he has to family, have been here the whole time without him. He has been kept in the dark and he has been kept with his relatives who many consider abusive. He is exhausted, drained.

Sirius only knows parts of this, but what he does know is how Harry defended his cousin, something that might give the illusion of closeness.

And the heartbreaking part isn’t that Sirius would have saved him if he knew. But he would have. He would have done whatever it took to get Harry out of that home, because it is heavily implied he grew up in an abusive family and he wouldn’t let his godson suffer the same thing.

The heartbreaking part is that Harry probably knew this and chose not to tell him. He chose not to tell him because he knew Sirius would take extreme measures if necessary and Harry cared more about his godfather’s safety than his own.

Questions: What are some common misconceptions that people who have read the Harry Potter books have?
Answers:
”You get your Hogwarts letter on your 11th birthday.”

The internet is filled with pictures such as these:

But this is all wrong.

Even if you, somehow, had been a muggleborn British Wizard/Witch, your Hogwarts letter wouldn’t have arrived as a surprise on your 11th Birthday. It arrives in July when you are eleven (or will be eleven by 1st September that year). And for muggleborns, I think we can assume someone arrives to them and explains about Hogwarts a few months earlier, but not on your birthday.

Harry only discovered he was a wizard on his 11th birthday because:

Harry got his first Hogwarts letter before his birthday, but the Dursleys didn’t allow him to read it. The letters then continued to arrive for a few days, until Hagrid showed up (that happened on his birthday).
Harry was not a muggleborn, so he was expected to know about magic and Hogwarts already.

It’s not the norm.

Questions: How come Dumbledore was feared by Voldemort?
Answers:
I think all the people talking about how powerful Dumbledore is have missed something important. Whilst it's clear that both Dumbledore and Voldemort are extremely powerful wizards, it's also clear there are other powerful wizards in the Harry Potter world who Voldemort doesn't fixate on. More importantly, Dumbledore, regardless of power, can't actually kill Voldemort because his soul is spread out among the horcruxes. Dumbledore is an inconvenience to Voldemort, not a genuine threat.

But Voldemort is still scared of him.

Voldemort's real source of power isn't just magic, it's terror. Voldemort is terrifying. He doesn't just have power, he has the will to use it for the most awful things imaginable. He'll torture you to madness, he'll kill everybody close to you, he'll even murder a newborn child. He's so terrifying that even a decade after he disappeared, everybody is too frightened to even say his name. This fear giving Voldemort power is a theme throughout the books, and it’s cleverly explored by how people address him.

Most of the wizarding world don't address him at all. He is ‘he who must not be named’ or ‘you know who’. He has power over them, because they live in terror of even the thought of him. Only the braver characters (Hermione, Harry, Lupin) call him Voldemort. They see him as a frightening creature, terrible as he is, but they refuse to let that fear have power over them. Until the very end of the last book there's only one character who calls him anything else: Dumbledore.

Dumbledore calls him ‘Tom.’

Not only does Dumbledore not give in to the fear of Voldemort, he doesn't even acknowledge he exists. He refuses to accept the monstrous persona Voldemort has built around himself and talks to him as an ordinary human being. And that's what really frightens Voldemort. People seeing what he really is. An ordinary, vulnerable human being so frightened that he tore his own soul apart to avoid having to confront his own mortality. A little boy afraid to face death. Voldemort is terrified that people will realise he's a fraud. And Dumbledore knows what he is.

In the end, there is one of other person who does this. It is, of course, Harry, who during their final confrontation calls him ‘Riddle'. He directly says he won't call him a Lord because he isn't one. He openly mocks Voldemort for putting his trust in Snape, letting him know that Dumbledore beat him yet again, without using any magic at all. That he's lost, and he isn't frightening at all, and murder is all he's got left and it doesn't even matter. He isn't scared of cowardly little Tom Riddle.

Voldemort is terrified of Dumbledore because from the very beginning Dumbledore is the one character who knows how small he is, how weak and alone he is, how afraid he is. Dumbledore knows Voldemort is just Tom Riddle, and that's what scares Voldemort most.

Questions: What are the darkest comics you’ve ever read?
Answers:
It was late at night and I was scrolling through Tumblr for some light humor before going to sleep, until I came across this gem of a short comic. I might have felt the intensiveness of the comic much more because it caught me off guard, but nonetheless here it is:

The comic reads:

“Life and death have been in love

for longer than we have words to describe.

Life sends countless gifts to death

and Death keeps them forever.”

Beautifully simple, but inexplicably dark.

Edit: thanks for the comments for the source of this work.

The artist’s name is Kitt Walker, check out more of her work here on her Tumblr page: I Make Stuff Sometimes

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
A man married a beautiful girl. He loved her very much.

One day she developed a skin disease. Slowly she started to lose her beauty. It so happened that one day her husband left for a tour.

While returning he met with an accident and lost his eyesight. However their married life continued as usual. But as days passed she lost her beauty gradually.

Blind husband did not know this and there was not any difference in their married life.

He continued to love her and she also loved him very much. One day she died. Her death brought him great sorrow.

He finished all her last rites and wanted to leave that town. A man from behind called and said, now how will you be able to walk all alone? All these days your wife used to help you. He replied, I am not blind.

I was acting, because if she knew l could see her ugliness it would have pained her more than her disease. So I pretended to be blind.

She was a very good wife. I only wanted to keep her happy.

Moral: Some times it is good for us to act blind and ignore one another's short comings, in order to be happy. No matter how many times the teeth bite the tongue, they still stay together in one mouth. That's the spirit of FORGIVENESS.

May God grant us all the spirit of forgiveness, unity and togetherness.

Questions: What are the biggest lies that society tells us?
Answers:
I think you are NOT happy.

Let’s see these two scenarios

The office shift ends at 6 PM on a Friday.

Nithyanand logs out of the system and runs out of the office building. He catches up with his college friends for dinner at a fine persian restaurant that night. They laugh a lot as they revisit their old memories. Meeting friends actually uplifts the soul, he posts online. Then they go to bar and drink all the way into the night, chatting and dancing to the hard rock music on the stage.

While at the same time,

Satyanand couldn’t leave work at 6PM as his code showed errors. He kept debugging and trying other alternatives. Finally, it was 9:30 PM, when it showed the desired result. He logged out of the system and went back to his room, reading his favourite nonfiction on the way. He made bindi fry and had it with rotis. Then he watched an episode on Netflix and dozed off on the sofa.

Now—

Which of these two people do you think are having an unhappy life?

.

.

.

Well—it might look surprising —but the answer is,

Neither of them.

Or to put it in the context of the famous movie 3 Idiots,

Chathur is as happy as Rancho.

This is one common myth about happiness.

The society expects happiness to always be a visible thing and that it should be expressed in specific patterns.

However,

There is a lot of difference between

Being happy

and

Showing the world that you are happy.

The latter is only a minor subset of the former one.

And it hugely depends on the societal perception of ‘happiness’ which may or may not be your definition.

For example,

a person sitting with a group of friends, laughing and sharing food with them in a crowded restaurant is considered happy and enthusiastic while a person sitting alone and eating is considered to be lonely and sad.
But it can be that he had avoided his friends and came there purposely alone to enjoy his favourite meal without any distraction. His happiness came from relishing it bite by bite.
a person with a long beard spending the whole weekend inside a room smoking and reading some huge books is considered as depressed and boring.
His happiness is coming from decoding the deep philosophical poems and he is as happy as the person posting a selfie with his friends at a Oktoberfest.

The problem here is not happiness, but that their behaviour doesn’t fit into how society defines happiness.

Films, media, social network often showcase this—People who slog day and night and do nothing but work are depicted as unhappy people who don’t value life. They had to be stopped and lectured ‘C’mon you should get a life! You should be happy.’ And then they realise the celebration of life by drinking, partying, surfing, parasailing and skydiving.

What makes you conclude that they are not happy?

How can you decide that this is the recipe of happiness for others?

I’ve seen lot of people—like researchers, scientists, developers, entrepreneurs—who yearn to work everyday and are not tired even after eighteen hours of work. They enjoy work like a glass of wine. They all find the same happiness in work which someone else finds in skydiving.

But because of such perceptions, they are conditioned to believe that they are not happy, something is wrong with them etc.

For example, now—say—after the weekend, Satyanand goes to office and Nithyanand tells him ‘You should enjoy. You should celebrate life, be happy every minute…’ This is the nth time he is listening to this. So, next time, he goes with him uninterested.

He is not a fan of persian food. He hates loud music. He doesn’t like beer. But he just sits with them so as to not disappoint them. He secretly starts feeling irritated that he is wasting time at a place he has no interest in…thus, his unhappiness curve begins.

You want to be happy because society has convinced you that so-called people are happy all the time. You want to be happy because you want to fit in.

But why should you fit into the parameters of some made-up definition of normalcy? You’re exhausted because you’re always pretending to be something you are not. You are constantly trying to reach this non-existent, ideal state if emotional well-being.

It’s not real. You are being set up to fail.

I have never been (Un)happier by Shaheen Bhatt

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Mom is the only person in the world who can do anything.

So, yesterday two of the highest viewed answers of my friend collapsed and he was little off.

Today he received a message from her on WhatsApp. So the conversation goes like this.

Mom:- What happened yesterday?

He:- Nothing much. Two of my answers got collapsed on Quora.

Mom:- What do you mean by collapse?

He:- Those two answers were removed from quora.

Mom:- Give me their numbers. I will talk with them.

He:- Leave it mom. Otherwise, they will shut down Quora and will run away.

Mom :- Okay then.

Quora moderators, be careful. Be very careful. If mom comes then you will have to suffer.

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
A popular fake Quora user was exposed today.

I found this post on Reddit
 and searched her name on Quora. She was pretty popular but was fake and was finally exposed.

So, this girl called Oakley Maverick who was using fake credentials and fake profile picture was exposed and it's the best thing I’ve read today and I felt good.

Why?

Because Quora doesn't stand for this. And, I and thousands of other quorans didn't sign up here to see a fake person using fake credentials and writing about their fake experiences, sharing their “knowledge”, just for the sake of popularity.

I wonder how many people were misinformed due to her, and how many people had read her content and had believed her.

PS: I just searched her again and she has become a Quora User now.

Edit: Here is the rest of the comment. The comment section was lit. Savage.

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Two days ago, I visited a Van Heusen 
store to buy a shirt for my dad. At the billing counter, like any other store, the cashier asked me if I need a bag to carry the shirt (because the bag is chargeable).

For my own convenience, I said I needed one. It happened to be a pretty paper bag. That's it about that day.

But today, when my mother was organising our room, I saw the bag lying on the floor. When I was about to pick it up to give it to my mom, I read this:

This bag comes at a small price ( a smaller price than what we all will pay if we continue to use plastic bags).

Simple, yet effective.

:)

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
I had read this on whatsapp-

A few years ago in-front of his eyes his girlfriend was brutally raped by six bastards in a running bus of Delhi.

He fought till the time he was beaten blue with an iron rod.

They broke his leg, robbed him, snatched his mobile & left him almost naked..

He fought till the time he could. Then on that chilling cold night he was thrown from the running bus along with his girl friend.

They were naked, drained, exhausted & both were bleeding for different reasons.

He tried to stop passing cars & kept on begging for a piece of shawl to wrap his naked girl friend & finally he got it after 40 minutes.

Then he took her to the hospital, admitted her, called the police,called her parents & did every possible co-operation that a true friend should do in the hour of need.

He could have fled from the bus - he did not.

He could have left her on the road - he did not.

He could have claimed fame & money ( as the father of Nirbhaya got Rs 25 lakhs from UP CM,his son got a job & many more ) - but he did not.

He could have claimed his treatment money from Govt - he did not.

He could have become the most frequently seen face in the electronic media in exchange of money - he did not.

*If this is not friendship then what is friendship??*

When the entire country roared for the girl no one thought what this boy had gone through that night.

He is not a film star or a cricketer.

He is *Awindra Pratap Pandey,* a boy from Gorakhpur in UP, the boy who loved his girl friend from the core of his heart.

When this boy is there somewhere in anonymity, why we Indians should celebrate Friendship Day on 3rd August to copy the Americans?

We should celebrate Friendship Day in India on *16th December* to salute the spirit of Awindra who proved what friendship means.

Let *16th December* be the official Friendship Day in India.

Am I talking sense??

If *yes* then please share & forward this to as many as you can…

Make this a right platform of social awareness !!."

Questions: What are the behaviors of a confident person?
Answers:
I am sure you must have have seen his interviews and speeches.

This is Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, an Indian diplomat and politician serving as the Minister of External Affairs of the government of India since May 2019.

Whenever I see his interviews, I see confidence, fearlessness and love for his country.

I will quote here an excerpt from one of his interviews which I saw recently.

The Interviewer : Mr Jaishankar there will always be two axis. At this point I think it's an understood fact that we have the US led west and the China led next potential axis. So where do you think India fits into?

Dr Jaishankar : This is exactly where I disagree with you. This is the construct you are trying to impose on me and I don't accept it. It's not important for me to join this axis and if i am not a part of this axis I need to join the other. We are 1/5 th of world population, 5th largest economy. I am entitled have my own side, I am entitled to have my own choices and my choices won't be cynical and transactional, but there will be a balance of my values and my interest. There is no country in this world that disregard it's interests.

To be honest I am a big fan of Dr S Jaishankar, maybe congress leader Rahul Gandhi calls it as an arrogant indian foreign policy but when I see him delivering speeches I can only see a confident man having immense love for his country.

Thanks for your valuable time 🙂

Priyambad Singh

Questions: When do we call someone an avid reader?
Answers:
Image source - Linkedin

This is Rakesh, he runs a used books stall in Andheri, Mumbai where you can rent a book for ₹10.

When asked if he earns enough doing this, he responded in a way that qualifies him to be what we call an avid reader.

His response was -”People earn so they can spend money on something they want. I am already surrounded by the one thing I always wanted to have”.

For me, he is one of the finest avid readers as he is far from distractions of life and doing the one thing that satisfies him the most. ❤😘

Edit - My first post to cross 10k+ upvotes.. Thankyou guys!

Edit - My first post to cross 150k+ content views🙏🙇

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
This one I read on WhatsApp. But strangely I found it worth sharing. It's really good. I hope we can share something that we read on WA.

A wise man asked, why do you have brakes in cars?

There were some logical replies,

To avoid accidents.
To reduce speed.
Basically, for safe driving.

That's not how the wise man perceived the importance of a brake. His answer was:

We have brakes, so that we can drive faster.

Now that was unexpected. People didn't agree at first. It didn't make much sense. But listen to the logic behind it…

If there are no brakes, any person would try to avoid accident by driving slow. Infact he won't drive at all. It's the security of working brakes that allows him to pick up speed, accelerate and reach his destination.

We can apply the same for life.

It's necessary to have a fallback option. It's necessary to have a source of mental support. Without their help, no man can rise. Who're they? Friends, family and colleagues.

They often question your actions, which may cause us to get irritated. But it's their constant nagging which involuntarily helps us stay right on track.

Without those brakes, we can skid, lose direction, and meet with an unfortunate accident.

Now I won't mind if my mom scolds me. I'll give her a kind smile and comply with whatever she asks.

Ok, no… I'll retaliate at times.

It's a beautiful message I found worth sharing. Thanks for reading.

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Have you heard about this man?

Yes, This is Afroz Shah, a Mumbai based lawyer who, a year back, was conferred with Champion of the Earth award, UN’s top reward recognising outstanding leaders who have striven to lead a positive impact on environment.

What did he do?

Look at the pictures..

He initiated the world's largest beach cleanup project at Versova Beach.

How did it begin?

Shah and his 84 year old neighbor Harbansh Mathur, were fed up of the debris and waste accumulated on Versova beach. They were determined to do something and took the colossal task of cleaning the beach into their own hands!

The pair started cleaning up the beach themselves, one piece of rubbish at a time. But they wanted others to join in this movement and spread awareness. Hence, they inspired youth and their neighbors and locals to get involved in the cleaning drive. His call was responded also by slum dwellers, journalists and celebrities. They came every weekend for their date with the ocean and contributed to Shah's effort. They did this continuously every weekend for almost 2 years in a knee deep rotting pile of garbages and the scorching Indian sun!

What was the result?

A clean beautiful beach!

The volunteers collected over 4,500 tons of trash from the 2.5 kilometre beach.

Hats off to Shah and Team. Take a bow!!

And what I read today made me super duper happy!!

“Olive ridley turtles hatch in Mumbai after two decades at Versova Beach"[1]

The ecosystem is returning to a place that was buried under tons and tons of garbage and waste for 20 long years!

Afroz Shah’s effort has been paid off! Respect you sir!!

You have set an example for the youth and for the public with your efforts and good work!

This is something surreal!

Our country needs people more like you.

You have really inspired us!

Footnotes

[1] In Pictures: After 20 years, Olive Ridley turtles hatch on Mumbai's Versova beach | Free Press Journal

Questions: Is Anne McCaffrey’s “Dragonriders of Pern” series science fiction? If yes, how so?
Answers:
It is definitely science fiction and Annie intended it to be taken as such. The original inhabitants arrive on Pern via space ship, a ship which is eventually found again. Thread is a space-fungus that can cross from another body in Pern’s system to the surface under certain conditions. Agenothree is HNO3, nitric acid. The dragons are genetically created from the native fire lizards. The bond between dragon and rider is telepathic.

Most of all, there is no magic.

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Police comes to Russian guy's rescue who was seen begging near a temple.

“Atithi devo bhavah”... This is not only something we Indians take pride in saying, this is the motto we live by.

The below example truly shows this spirit.

A tourist from Russia was seen begging outside the Kumarakottam Murugan temple in Kanchipuram. People there inquired about him and informed police to look into the matter as he seemed lost. A team of police from Siva Kanchi police station arrived and found out that he was a 32 year old research student from Russia, who has simply exhausted all his money.

The guy's name was “Evangelin Burngowe”. He had arrived in India on 8th September on tourist visa.

After touring places in North India, Burngowe had reached Kancheepuram by bus from Bangalore. He exhausted all his money on mobile phone and the main problem arrived when he forgot the pin of his debit card. He said he had no other options so he decided to beg for money.

The police verified his documents and found that his documents were all valid and the story was indeed true.

Then he was given Rs. 500 and the police authorities put him on a train to Chennai. They asked him to get down at Egmore and take an autorickshaw to the Russian embassy in the City.

Given the image of police in today's scenario, this was a worth mentioning effort by them. Also salute to the local people for their spirit.

Amidst all the negative issues that media portrays, this was indeed a breath of fresh air.

Humanity is still alive.

Hail humanity.

Source: Police Comes To A Russian Guy’s Rescue Who Was Seen Begging Outside Kanchi Temple

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Presence of mind of Swami Vivekananda:

Swamiji used to dress like a monk because he was an ascetic. He used to travel in India and sometimes abroad too.

Once he was visiting a foreign country where a foreigner pulled his turban.

Swamiji: Why did you pull my turban?

Foreigner: Oh! Do you speak English?

Swamiji: Yes. I do speak English.

Foreigner: Are you educated?

Swamiji : Yes, I'm educated.

Foreigner: Are you a gentleman?

Swamiji: Yes, I am.

Foreigner :Gentlemen shouldn't wear dresses like this.

Swamiji : In your country, tailor makes you a gentleman. In my country, my character makes me a gentleman.

:)

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
I was going through my feed in LinkedIn and found this beautiful and heart warming poem dedicated to all the soldiers:

“We both left home at 18,

You cleared JEE, I got recommended.

You got IIT, I got NDA.

You pursued your degree, I had the toughest training.

Your day started at 7 and ended at 5, mine started at 4 till 9 and some nights also included.

You had your convocation ceremony, I had my POP (Passing Out Parade).

Best company took you and best package was awarded, I was ordered to join my Paltan with 2 stars piped on my shoulders.

You got a job,I got a way of life.

Every eve you got to see your family, I just wished I got to see my parents soon.

You celebrated festivals with lights and music, I celebrated with my comrade in bunkers.

We both married and your wife got to see you everyday, My wife just wished I was alive.

You were sent to business trips, I was sent on line of control.

We both returned, Both wives couldn't control their tears, you wiped hers but, I couldn't...

You hugged her but, I couldn't. Because I was lying in the coffin, with medals on my chest and coffin wrapped with tricolor.

My way of life ended... Your continued.

We both left home at 18.”

Salute to all the Indian soldiers!!!

Jai Hind!!!

Reference of this Beautiful Piece of Poem:

https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/we-both-left-home-18-jenil-j/

Questions: Can you share a picture of your book collection?
Answers:
That's me in euphoria when I finally designed myself a book shelf and had it built. It brought together the elements I love to do. Read and Design.

I've been buying books for years now and reached a point where I had more books in my closet than clothes.

So I decided to renovate the space in my room and create a book shelf, the idea was to utilize the maximum space but also something that gives me accessibility and allows me to easily find the books I need.

Voila

I couldn’t wait until the shelf was completed, so used to arrange the books at the end of each day the minute carpenter left.

Let me walk you through,

Romantic Fiction

Suspense/Thrillers

Books that have been adapted into movies

The Classics

Fantasy fiction/Classics and poetry

Horror and Reference

Encyclopedias and Reference

Questions: What is something that is really dark in the Harry Potter series that is really just kind of ignored?
Answers:
Hermione's parents.

At the beginning of the Deathly Hallows, Hermione casually mentions to Ron and Harry that she altered her parents' memories and gave them new identities as Wendell and Monica Wilkins who wish to move to Australia, to protect them from the Death Eaters.

Imagine for a second, doing that to your parents, whom you have known all your life, who you know loves you more than anyone else in the entire world. If something goes wrong, then Hermione is left parentless.

Hermione made the biggest sacrifice of them all, but no one even bothered to check how she was doing with it throughout the entire period. She left her parents in such a state to fight along with Ron and Harry.

That takes guts and a huge amount of bravery. For a child to do that to their own parents for whatever reason, is extraordinary I think.

But sadly, it is just ignored in the book and the movie. A mere bump on the road in the whole scheme of things.

Questions: If you could write a letter to any fictional character, what and who would you write?
Answers:
Dear Popeye,

I was annoyed with you as a kid for a couple of reasons.

Spinach in my place didn't come in cans. I couldn't crush the can and swallow the spinach.
Spinach didn't make my muscles expand either.

But now I have to thank you for making me like spinach. You had class, unlike the trash they show kids nowadays.

:*

Gakekekekekkeke. Well played, sailor.

Kavya.

Questions: What is one thing you read today that made you happy?
Answers:
Today Morning, I logged in to my LinkedIn profile and I read this amazing post by One member

She wrote- “An Instance which left me with a great learning, I had to travel to Delhi for some official work and so booked a Cab. The Taxi driver was a tall man with heavy built body. He must be in his late 30s or early 40s. The drive started and on his dashboard was lying a book, a pencil and an eraser. He handed over these items to me and very gently said , " Mam can you please fill in the pages." I opened the book and that was an assignment having multiple choice questions and mental ability tests along with some English Grammar exercises. I guessed it right. This was the holiday homework for his Son. I was surprised and told him I won't do it as his son should attempt the same else he will not get to learn anything. He, very humbly, folded his hands and said,"please do this. I will click the photograph of the same and then erase all the answers and then give it to my son to complete it. At least I should have the right answers with me". I was astounded!!! “

Lessons I learned from this

1. Passion he has to complete the task, even if he is not equipped to do so

2. He has clear focus. He knows what to do and will devise the ways to do the same, even if that is beyond his capability.”

This really made me HAPPY...!! Cheers!

Questions: Why do leftists in America whine so much over "book bans", but refuse to return the Bible to public schools?
Answers:
No one has banned the Bible at schools. Any student who want to bring a Bible to school and read it is free to do so. The school libraries are free to have it in the library.

What they cannot do is teach that the Bible as a fact or attempt to indoctrinate a child into a specific religion. It is often part of a comparative religion course in the schools along with the books and teachings of many other religions.

No dear, bibles are not banned in schools it is just not allowed to force one religion down the throat of kids of another or no faith.

A teacher is not allowed to prefer one religion over another in teaching. You know that constitution thing.

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Do you know her?

She is Tilly Smith.

When she was 10, she went to vacation with her family in Thailand.

Everything was going well in until she felt something weird in the sea.

She warned her parents of the impending tsunami by the motion of the waves.

Her parents didn't underestimate her warning and they warned everyone.

People rapidly cleared the beach and went to safe places.

Moments later, the tsunami struck the shore and destroyed everything.

The knowledge of such a little girl left me awestruck when I read about her. When I was her age, I didn't know anything beyond Pokémon.

Questions: What is Mercedes Lackey's opinion of novels based on movies?
Answers:
LOL! This is a pretty funny thing to ask me, because at one point in my career I would have given a foot (not a hand, I need those) for the movie-to-book opportunities some of my colleagues were getting.

I think if the production company hires a decent writer, they can be great fun, and if they hire a great writer, they can be wonderful expansions on the original story. Michael Crichton is known for this—of course, he’s also a screenplay writer so he knows both sides of the genre.

Questions: What is the greatest monster/creature in all of fiction?
Answers:
Nothing really beats the super massive beast playing galactic marbles at the end of credit scene for Men In Black 1.

Do you know whats the ball in this hand? Almost an entire Galaxy which in itself is several million light years across.

That would make the hand and the creature itself measuring several trillion light years in size. This beast is so soo massive that even Solar system would be smaller than one atom is to us.

Now the kicker. The beast picks up a million light years huge galaxy and within one second throws it across and then in a large bag with many galaxies. Therefore traversing trillion of light years in merely a second. The speed of this beast is trillion light years per second! There is no sense of time and/or space at such an unimaginably massive speed. I know this beast is fiction but even in fiction this beast redefines almost every known law of physics…

I think this beast really fits the title of “the greatest monster/creature in all of fiction”

EDIT1: Thank you to everyone who took time to read and upvote!

Questions: Why do people who love reading, love it so much?
Answers:
(Spoiler alert: Anna Karenina, Leo Tolstoy)

Do you know where I am right now?
In the general ladies coach of train from Surat to Baroda ( Gujarat, India). I am surrounded by sweating fat ladies on all four sides. There's no place to sit, I am standing in the aisle. Someone again left the toilet door open, it's stinking. Two women are fighting for a seat, calling each other names. A baby is crying somewhere due to the commotion, the stink and the heat.

Before I opened Quora on my phone, I was reading Anna Karenina by Leo Tolstoy. For about an hour, I forgot that I was in the hot, stinking, crowded train in India.

I was hunting with Levin in the fields of Yasyana Polyana, Russia. I could feel the cold morning air and the dew under my feet.
I was worrying about my farm and cattle, and the kopecks (old Russian currency) I owed to various people.

I was having an affair with Vronsky, feeling the passion and regret. Waiting for my lover to come back from a party, worrying whether he was with some other woman. I looked at myself in the mirror to see whether my beauty was intact.

I just committed suicide by jumping in front of a train due to my insecurity.

Maybe I will never visit fields of russia, never have an extra marital affair, never commit suicide. But for an hour, I felt all of it. I was there. Not with them. I was them.

My first 1k! Thanks for all the upvotes. :)

Questions: Who agrees with Elliott Hulse when he says it's okay to judge a book by its cover because the cover of the book is going to tell you what's inside of it guaranteed?
Answers:
Absolutely, positively, not.

What do you think this is about?

Looks like a book about a circus horse (that’s a circus stunt rig she’s wearing) that’s somehow able to levitate tires, doesn’t it? Well it’s one of my “Arrows of the Queen” books, Arrow’s Flight, I think.

How about this one?

OK, looks like an adventure in a desert in which some species of cat is the main character right? Nope. It’s Storm Breaking, there’s not a desert or a cat in sight, and neither of the horses on that cover are Companions.

And here’s another cover of the same book.

Well this is a little better. At least there’s a hint of the remains of Urtho’s Tower. But if that’s the Dhorisha Plains I’ll eat my hat, and I don’t think I’ll be dining on felt any time soon.

This isn’t a bad cover, it just is absolutely not informative.

But I am saving the “best” for last.

WTF is going on here??????? I can’t even. What about any of this cover says Arrows of the Queen besides the title? Sweet Baby Jesus, what drugs was that artist taking? I want to know so I can avoid them.

Questions: Why is the book "Stoned Souls" by Mercedes Lackey and Josepha Sherman not available? It is book #5 in the Serrated Edge series, but all the other books in the series are available in paper and/or e-book format - just not this one.
Answers:
Unforunately Josepha refused to actually collaborate on this book, went ahead and wrote the whole thing on her own, turned it in to me, and it was utterly unacceptable. There were gigantic plot holes, things she just ignored (like the existance of cell phones in a high school) because they weren’t convenient for her “plot” and things that were so wrong they created singularities—like having a basement in a high school in Florida. It wasn’t just me. I ran the manuscript past a bunch of the Barflies at Baen’s Bar and the universal reaction was “this is worse than the worst fanfiction I have ever seen.”

Eric Flint and I were going to do something with it, things got so tangled up with his death that now I am afraid the project is in limbo. My agent is trying to untangle the situation.

Questions: How do Harry Potter movie series characters look in the books?
Answers:
Oh, this is my chance! I recently came across this artist named Giblimort (go check her out on tumblr or Ao3) who uses some program to do some amazing real life like portraits of the Harry Potter characters, I have contacted her and asked if I could share her work around with obvious credit which she kindly agreed upon, mind you though some of the characters she depicted through the ages and with some such as with Harry she sadly only depicted all grown up.

Harry Potter (grown up)

“Do you remember me telling you we are practicing non-verbal spells, Potter?”

“Yes,” said Harry stiffly.

“Yes, sir.”

“There’s no need to call me “sir” Professor.”

The words had escaped him before he knew what he was saying.

― Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Ron Weasley (grown up)

“And from now on, I don’t care if my tea leaves spell die, Ron, die — I’m just chucking them in the bin where they belong.”

― Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Hermione Granger (through the ages)

“Books! And cleverness! There are more important things — friendship and bravery and — oh Harry — be careful!”

— Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone

Tom Riddle (transformation to Voldemort)

Voldemort had entered the room. His features were not those Harry had seen emerge from the great stone cauldron almost two years before; they were not as snake-like, the eyes were not yet scarlet, the face yet not manlike, and yet he was no longer handsome Tom Riddle. It was as though his features has been burned and blurred, they were waxy and oddly distorted, and the whites of his eyes now had a permanently bloody look, though the pupils were not yet the slits that Harry knew they would become.

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Severus Snape

“Look...at...me...” he whispered.

The green eyes found the black, but after a second, something in the depths of the dark pair seemed to vanish, leaving them fixed, blank, and empty. The hand holding Harry thudded to the floor, and Snape moved no more.

― Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Sirius Black (before and after Azkaban)

“Come on, you can do better than that!” he yelled, his voice echoing around the cavernous room.

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

James Potter

“Lily, take Harry and go! It’s him! Go! Run! I’ll hold him off —”

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Remus Lupin

“Did you like question ten, Moony?” asked Sirius as they emerged into the entrance hall.

"Loved it," said Lupin briskly. “Give five signs that identify the werewolf. Excellent question.”

“D'you think you managed to get all the signs?” said James in tones of mock concern.

“Think I did,” said Lupin seriously, as they joined the crowd thronging around the front doors eager to get out into the sunlit grounds.

“One: He's sitting on my chair. Two: He's wearing my clothes. Three: His name's Remus Lupin...”

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Lily Potter

Lily’s smile was widest of all. She pushed her long hair back as she drew close to him, and her green eyes, so like his, searched his face hungrily, as though she would never be able to look at him enough.

“You’ve been so brave.”

He could not speak. His eyes feasted on her, and he thought that he would like to stand and look at her forever, and that would be enough.

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Ginny Weasley (through the ages)

“Anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.”

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Molly Weasley

Mrs. Weasley set the potion down on the bedside cabinet, bent down, and put her arms around Harry. He had no memory of ever being hugged like this, as though by a mother. The full weight of everything he had seen that night seemed to fall in upon him as Mrs. Weasley held him to her.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Arthur Weasley

“Your sons flew that car to Harry's house and back last night!'”

“Did you really?” said Mr Weasley eagerly. “Did it go all right? I-I mean,” he faltered as sparks flew from Mrs Weasley's eyes, “that-that was very wrong, boys – very wrong indeed ...”

— Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Draco Malfoy (grown up)

“Signed photos? You’re giving out signed photos, Potter?”

― Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Lucius Malfoy

“Lucius my slippery friend,” he whispered, halting before him. “I am told that you have not renounced the old ways, though to the world you present a respectable face.”

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Narcissa Malfoy

"There is nothing I wouldn't do anymore!"

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Bellatrix Lestrange (motion)

"Never used an Unforgivable Curse before, have you, boy? You need to mean them Potter! You need to really want to cause pain -- to enjoy it -- righteous anger won't hurt me for long -- I'll show you how it is done, shall I? I'll give you a lesson."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Andromeda Tonks

“We — Narcissa and I — have never set eyes on our sister since she married the Mudblood .”

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Fred Weasley

And Percy was shaking his brother, and Ron was kneeling beside them, and Fred's eyes stared without seeing, the ghost of his last laugh still etched upon his face.

― Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

George Weasley

“What do we want to be prefects for?” said George, looking revolted at the very idea. “It’d take all the fun out of life.”

― Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Luna Lovegood

"I believe He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named is back, and I believe you fought him and escaped from him."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Percy Weasley

“I was a fool!" Percy roared, so loudly that Lupin nearly dropped his photograph.

"I was a pompous prat, I was a- a-"

"Ministry loving, family-disowning, power-hungry moron," said Fred.

Percy swallowed.

"Yes, I was!"

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Bill Weasley

“Bill was — there was no other word for it — cool. He was tall, with long hair that he had tied back in a ponytail. He was wearing an earring with what looked like a fang dangling from it. Bill’s clothes would not have looked out of place at a rock concert, except that Harry recognized his boots to be made, not of leather, but of dragon hide.”

― Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Fleur Delacour

“Excuse me, are you wanting ze bouillabaisse?"

It was the girl from Beauxbatons who had laughed during Dumbledore's speech. She had finally removed her muffler. A long sheet of silvery-blonde hair fell almost to her waist. She had large, deep blue eyes, and very white, even teeth.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Cedric Diggory

“Remember Cedric. Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right, and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.”

― Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Nymphadora Tonks (motion)

“And this is Nymphadora-”

“Don’t call me Nymphadora, Remus”, said the young witch with a shudder. “It’s Tonks.”

“Nymphadora Tonks”, who prefers to be known by her surname only,” finished Lupin.

“So would you if your fool of a mother had called you ‘Nymphadora,” muttered Tonks.

― Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Cho Chang

The Ravenclaw team, dressed in blue, were already standing in the middle of the field. Their Seeker, Cho Chang, was the only girl on their team. She was shorter than Harry by about a head, and Harry couldn’t help noticing, nervous as he was, that she was extremely pretty. She smiled at Harry as the teams faced each other behind their captains, and he felt a slight lurch in the region of his stomach that he didn’t think had anything to do with nerves.

— Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Charlie Weasley

"Charlie's in the Order, too, but he's still in Romania. Dumbledore wants as many foreign wizards brought in as possible, so Charlie's trying to make contacts on his days off."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Pansy Parkinson

“But, he’s there! Potter’s there! Someone grab him!”

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Regulus Black

To the Dark Lord,

I know I will be dead long before you read this but I want you to know that it was I who discovered your secret. I have stolen the real Horcrux and intend to destroy it as soon as I can. I face death in the hope that when you meet your match, you will be mortal once more.

R.A.B

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Parvati & Padma Patil

“I still can’t get how the two of you got the best looking girls in our year” Dean said to Ron and Harry.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Walburga Black

"My mother didn't have a heart, Kreacher," snapped Sirius. "She kept herself alive out of pure spite."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

The Potter Siblings

The Granger-Weasley Siblings

Teddy Lupin

Lily Potter

Lily’s smile was widest of all. She pushed her long hair back as she drew close to him, and her green eyes, so like his, searched his face hungrily, as though she would never be able to look at him enough.

“You’ve been so brave.”

He could not speak. His eyes feasted on her, and he thought that he would like to stand and look at her forever, and that would be enough.

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Ginny Weasley (through the ages)

“Anything's possible if you've got enough nerve.”

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Molly Weasley

Mrs. Weasley set the potion down on the bedside cabinet, bent down, and put her arms around Harry. He had no memory of ever being hugged like this, as though by a mother. The full weight of everything he had seen that night seemed to fall in upon him as Mrs. Weasley held him to her.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Arthur Weasley

“Your sons flew that car to Harry's house and back last night!'”

“Did you really?” said Mr Weasley eagerly. “Did it go all right? I-I mean,” he faltered as sparks flew from Mrs Weasley's eyes, “that-that was very wrong, boys – very wrong indeed ...”

— Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Draco Malfoy (grown up)

“Signed photos? You’re giving out signed photos, Potter?”

― Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets

Lucius Malfoy

“Lucius my slippery friend,” he whispered, halting before him. “I am told that you have not renounced the old ways, though to the world you present a respectable face.”

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Narcissa Malfoy

"There is nothing I wouldn't do anymore!"

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Bellatrix Lestrange (motion)

"Never used an Unforgivable Curse before, have you, boy? You need to mean them Potter! You need to really want to cause pain -- to enjoy it -- righteous anger won't hurt me for long -- I'll show you how it is done, shall I? I'll give you a lesson."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Andromeda Tonks

“We — Narcissa and I — have never set eyes on our sister since she married the Mudblood .”

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Fred Weasley

And Percy was shaking his brother, and Ron was kneeling beside them, and Fred's eyes stared without seeing, the ghost of his last laugh still etched upon his face.

― Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

George Weasley

“What do we want to be prefects for?” said George, looking revolted at the very idea. “It’d take all the fun out of life.”

― Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Luna Lovegood

"I believe He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named is back, and I believe you fought him and escaped from him."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Percy Weasley

“I was a fool!" Percy roared, so loudly that Lupin nearly dropped his photograph.

"I was a pompous prat, I was a- a-"

"Ministry loving, family-disowning, power-hungry moron," said Fred.

Percy swallowed.

"Yes, I was!"

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Bill Weasley

“Bill was — there was no other word for it — cool. He was tall, with long hair that he had tied back in a ponytail. He was wearing an earring with what looked like a fang dangling from it. Bill’s clothes would not have looked out of place at a rock concert, except that Harry recognized his boots to be made, not of leather, but of dragon hide.”

― Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Fleur Delacour

“Excuse me, are you wanting ze bouillabaisse?"

It was the girl from Beauxbatons who had laughed during Dumbledore's speech. She had finally removed her muffler. A long sheet of silvery-blonde hair fell almost to her waist. She had large, deep blue eyes, and very white, even teeth.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Cedric Diggory

“Remember Cedric. Remember, if the time should come when you have to make a choice between what is right, and what is easy, remember what happened to a boy who was good, and kind, and brave, because he strayed across the path of Lord Voldemort. Remember Cedric Diggory.”

― Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Nymphadora Tonks (motion)

“And this is Nymphadora-”

“Don’t call me Nymphadora, Remus”, said the young witch with a shudder. “It’s Tonks.”

“Nymphadora Tonks”, who prefers to be known by her surname only,” finished Lupin.

“So would you if your fool of a mother had called you ‘Nymphadora,” muttered Tonks.

― Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Cho Chang

The Ravenclaw team, dressed in blue, were already standing in the middle of the field. Their Seeker, Cho Chang, was the only girl on their team. She was shorter than Harry by about a head, and Harry couldn’t help noticing, nervous as he was, that she was extremely pretty. She smiled at Harry as the teams faced each other behind their captains, and he felt a slight lurch in the region of his stomach that he didn’t think had anything to do with nerves.

— Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban

Charlie Weasley

"Charlie's in the Order, too, but he's still in Romania. Dumbledore wants as many foreign wizards brought in as possible, so Charlie's trying to make contacts on his days off."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

Pansy Parkinson

“But, he’s there! Potter’s there! Someone grab him!”

— Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows

Regulus Black

To the Dark Lord,

I know I will be dead long before you read this but I want you to know that it was I who discovered your secret. I have stolen the real Horcrux and intend to destroy it as soon as I can. I face death in the hope that when you meet your match, you will be mortal once more.

R.A.B

— Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince

Parvati & Padma Patil

“I still can’t get how the two of you got the best looking girls in our year” Dean said to Ron and Harry.

— Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire

Walburga Black

"My mother didn't have a heart, Kreacher," snapped Sirius. "She kept herself alive out of pure spite."

— Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

The Potter Siblings

The Granger-Weasley Siblings

Teddy Lupin', 'aiModelVersion': '1'}

Questions: What are the most cleverly designed book covers?
Answers:
There was a heat sensitive version of Fahrenheit 451 that made the rounds on the interwebs a few days ago:

Pretty hot stuff, right?

But before everyone got all fired up about that another cool design of the book had created some sparks:

The 1 in the 451 was a match that you could easily light upon the spine of the book, which was printed on matchbook paper, to test whether paper does indeed burn at 451°.

It might not be the most clever design, but it certainly is striking.

Questions: Who is the most underrated character in Harry Potter?
Answers:
This woman. She was right about everything and nobody believed her. She participated in the battle of Hogwarts. She didn’t bully students the way Snape did despite how they thought of and treated her; she recognized the censure and spent her time hidden away in her tower, with a warm fire and squishy chairs.

When thirteen dine together, the first to rise will be the first to die. Pettigrew was at the table, in Ron’s pocket, and Dumbledore stood up to greet Trelawney when she came in. Practically every word out of her mouth was a prophecy, and she will never receive any respect for her ability.

Questions: Why is it taking so long for George RR Martin to finish Winds of Winter?
Answers:
He has the same problem as Tolstoy had with The Decembrists.

Tolstoy. His surname can be translated as “Fatso”

Tolstoy wanted to write a book about the Decembrist, a less known unsuccessful coup in Russia that occured in December of 1825. Tolstoy wanted to write about their leaders, their goals, causes for their failure and so on. Yet he found he couldn’t properly explore that if he didn’t write about an earlier even that set the things in motion, the Napoleonic invasion of Russia. He determined the only way to properly approach the issue of The Decembrists was to write a prequel first.

He did the logical thing and wrote a book that wasn’t a novel, much less a poem, you now know it as War and Peace. This book was so successful, so different and took up so much of his time he never finished The Decembrists. Three unfinished chapters exist, but for better or worse, he devoted his time to other projects instead.

This is rather similar to the issues GRRM has with A Song of Ice and Fire. The key takeaway of the series is the relevation of Danny as the villain, whom we all (well, almost all) worshiped as the hero, there are others yes, many of them, but this arc is the key to the whole thing. However he couldn’t write about the villain you thought was hero, without making her the hero to begin with. Plus he absolutely had to write about a whole host of other things that also happen in the realm, to set the tone and deconstruct the idea of the hero a hundred and one more times.

Eventually all became too much and he was distracted by other projects. I do hope he still finishes someday, though the outlook seems bleak at this point.

Questions: What movie or book has an alternative or changed ending that significantly changes the whole story?
Answers:
I Am Legend.

In the alternate ending, Will Smith discovers that the … zombie things (I forget what they were called) came to get the woman back. Instead of killing everyone, he stops the experiment and releases her.
Then he walks away. They don’t attack. They didn’t come for him, they came to rescue her. Will & company just walk out.
It shows that they are intelligent and have some of the same emotions they had before. From mindless zombies that need be cured or destroyed, this ending suggests they are people.

The title “I Am Legend”, in the book, comes from the idea that the Doctor is the bogeyman, the dark and scary legend told around the campfire, to the zombievampires. HE is the bad guy, he’s the monster coming out to snatch people in the light (instead of the dark) to perform horrible experiments on them and then kill them.

That doesn’t really come across as well in the released version, in my opinion

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
A 9 Year Old Boy Wrote A Letter To NASA Asking For a Job-

He wrote this-

“Dear NASA,

My name is Jack Davis and I would like to apply for the planetary protection officer job. I may be nine but I think I would be fit for the job. One of the reasons is my sister says I am an alien. Also, I have seen almost all the space movies and alien movies I can see. I have also seen the show Marvel Agents of Shield and hope to see the movie Men in Black. I am great at vidieo [sic] games. I am young, so I can learn to think like an alien.

Sincerely,
Jack Davis
Guardian of the Galaxy
Fourth Grade”

He too got a reply from the Director of the Planetary science-

“Dear Jack,

I hear you are a ‘Guardian of the Galaxy’ and that you’re interested in being a NASA Plantary Protection Officer. That’s great!

Our Plantary Protection Officer position is really cool and is very important work. It’s about protecting Earth from tiny microbes when we bring back samples from the Moon, asteroids and Mars. It’s also about protecting other planets and moons from our germs as we responsibly explore the Solar System.

We are always looking for bright future scientists and engineers to help us, so I hope you will study hard and do well in school. We hope to see you here at NASA one of these days!

Sincerely,
Dr. James L. Green
Director, Planetary Science Division”

This was really amazing.

Kids are very innocent.

Thank You!!!

Questions: Which line in the Harry Potter series touched you the most?
Answers:
“What was there to be gained by fighting the most evil wizard who has ever existed?” said Black, with a terrible fury in his face. “Only innocent lives, Peter!”

“You don’t understand!” whined Pettigrew. “He would have killed me, Sirius!”

“THEN YOU SHOULD HAVE DIED!” roared Black. “DIED RATHER THAN BETRAY YOUR FRIENDS, AS WE WOULD HAVE DONE FOR YOU!”

I love how plain and dry Sirius’ words are. He doesn’t deny that Wormtail would die, he doesn’t invoke any kind of heroism or trick that would help him escape Voldemort if he wanted to. He simply says that there are things far worse than death, and that betraying your loved ones is obviously one of them. That’s a recurring theme throughout the entire Harry Potter book series, but Sirius’ desperate and aching fury is the best way to fully understand it.

Questions: What interesting thing did you read today?
Answers:
This thing appeared in the THE HINDU. I was both happy and sad after I read it.

Most of us have watched Swades movie starring SRK, but very few of us knew whose life was portrayed in this film. The real MOHAN was RAVI KUCHIMANCHI, a physicist, who helped the people of Bilgaon, Maharashtra to have access to electricity.

He was awarded Sakharov Prize by the American Physical Society.He founded the Association for India’s Development which collects funds upto millions every year for India.

Questions: What are some daily habits that can change my life?
Answers:
100 squats and 100 sit ups per day.
Cleaning your tongue too, not just teeth brushing.
Giving less flying unicorns about trivial stuff.
Reading or listening to audiobooks. Mostly non-fiction, in my opinion. Another good substitute is Ted Talks.
Creating more, not just consuming. Like writing or coding.

Questions: Why is the Bible the most stolen book in America?
Answers:
Back when I did prepress for a living, one of my clients was a Christian book publisher. I did the book catalog they distributed to Christian bookstores every year.

The guy I worked for told me that Christian bookstores have huge problems with Bibles, especially fancy expensive Bibles, being stolen. We had an interesting conversation about this. Apparently, at least according to him, there are a lot of reasons for it, including:

In many Evangelical communities, having an expensive Bible is a status symbol, like a high-end smartphone or expensive watch;
The people who steal Bibles rationalize it by saying that spreading God’s word is good, and that it’s not wrong to want to have God’s word, so it’s not “really” stealing; and
Besides, those bookstores sell plenty of books anyway, so it’s not like one Bible is really that big a deal. Wouldn’t God want them to have it? If the book store is doing God’s work, wouldn’t the book store want people to have Bibles?

Questions: Is it possible for an entire book to be written so that at the very last phrase, the meaning of the rest of the novel changes entirely?
Answers:
Would you mind if it did by the “last chapter” rather than the “last sentence”? Here it is:

“Si” by Bob Ong

It’s published last 2014. A short read with only 185 pages and large font size. Sadly, this book is only available in our language (Filipino). (There's no official nor fan translation available anywhere, my bros and sis). What made this book interesting is that the story is in reverse order.

The book starts with chapter “72” and ends with chapter “0”. Each chapter tells the most significant event in EVERY YEAR of the MC’s life, from when he’s 72 years old up to when he’s still inside his mom’s womb (0 yrs old). And you’re supposed to read it that way.

[Spoiler-Alert]
So what’s special about the ending?

The book is all about a man’s life. I mean, everything. It is a story about love, family, friendship, life during WW 2 and every other things that everyone may have once or wished to experience. The story developed with a magical feels to it because of the reverse order that would make you feel nostalgic in every chapter.

It’s as if you’re looking through the eyes of an old man recalling his past before he leaves this world peacefully.

But once you reach chapter “0” where he’s still not born, you’ll realize how wrong you were. Here’s an excerpt from that chapter:

“Ngunit tulad ng dati ay binulungan ako ni Ina. At sa dulo ng bawat luha ay muling nakiusap na patawarin ko siya. Nagsumamo ako. Sa huling pagkakataon . At ipinagmakaawa ang karapatan ng aking buhay”

Translation: “But just like before, my Mom whispered to me. And in every drop of tears, she’d ask me to forgive her. I plead. For the last time. I begged for my right to live.”

And the last few sentences of the book described how he slowly lost his senses. From how it’s getting quieter, how it’s getting colder, how it’s getting darker.

It squeezed my heart to pulp as it only implies that: He was aborted.

The book was NEVER about how a man struggled and lived his life BUT about a life that someone would have had if he was given the chance to live.

It also made me facepalm ‘cause I never saw that coming despite all the clues like:

Snow. Philippines is a tropical country meaning there’s no snow here. The snowflakes on the book cover and the scenes were there’s snow symbolizes imagination in our context.

The Title. Which is “Si”. Si is a Filipino article (like a, an, the) that ALWAYS comes before a name. (Ex. Si Vans, Si Elon) So why only “Si ____”? Because the MC never had a name. Why no name? Because it was our parents who give us a name when we are born. He never had a name because he was never born.

MC’s name was never mentioned. Because he didn’t have one. Also, lack of name symbolizes his lack of identity or place in the real world.

The Overview. It’s comprised of a dialogue that goes like…

MC: “When will I meet you?”

Victoria (love interest): “Once you’re born”

-=-=-=--=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

We all knew how annoying was the trope “It never happened” but this book’s message saved it from that.

It’s true that our life depends on the choices we’ll make. That our destiny is in our own hands. But none of that would have mattered if our parents never let us live in the first place.

PS: This is my first post in Quora. I hope I made sense…

PPS: I am a very timid person and this surge of upvotes and comments made me shake invariably in my insides**

It’s published last 2014. A short read with only 185 pages and large font size. Sadly, this book is only available in our language (Filipino). (There's no official nor fan translation available anywhere, my bros and sis). What made this book interesting is that the story is in reverse order.

The book starts with chapter “72” and ends with chapter “0”. Each chapter tells the most significant event in EVERY YEAR of the MC’s life, from when he’s 72 years old up to when he’s still inside his mom’s womb (0 yrs old). And you’re supposed to read it that way.

[Spoiler-Alert]
So what’s special about the ending?

The book is all about a man’s life. I mean, everything. It is a story about love, family, friendship, life during WW 2 and every other things that everyone may have once or wished to experience. The story developed with a magical feels to it because of the reverse order that would make you feel nostalgic in every chapter.

It’s as if you’re looking through the eyes of an old man recalling his past before he leaves this world peacefully.

But once you reach chapter “0” where he’s still not born, you’ll realize how wrong you were. Here’s an excerpt from that chapter:

“Ngunit tulad ng dati ay binulungan ako ni Ina. At sa dulo ng bawat luha ay muling nakiusap na patawarin ko siya. Nagsumamo ako. Sa huling pagkakataon . At ipinagmakaawa ang karapatan ng aking buhay”

Translation: “But just like before, my Mom whispered to me. And in every drop of tears, she’d ask me to forgive her. I plead. For the last time. I begged for my right to live.”

And the last few sentences of the book described how he slowly lost his senses. From how it’s getting quieter, how it’s getting colder, how it’s getting darker.

It squeezed my heart to pulp as it only implies that: He was aborted.

The book was NEVER about how a man struggled and lived his life BUT about a life that someone would have had if he was given the chance to live.

It also made me facepalm ‘cause I never saw that coming despite all the clues like:

Snow. Philippines is a tropical country meaning there’s no snow here. The snowflakes on the book cover and the scenes were there’s snow symbolizes imagination in our context.

The Title. Which is “Si”. Si is a Filipino article (like a, an, the) that ALWAYS comes before a name. (Ex. Si Vans, Si Elon) So why only “Si ____”? Because the MC never had a name. Why no name? Because it was our parents who give us a name when we are born. He never had a name because he was never born.

MC’s name was never mentioned. Because he didn’t have one. Also, lack of name symbolizes his lack of identity or place in the real world.

The Overview. It’s comprised of a dialogue that goes like…

MC: “When will I meet you?”

Victoria (love interest): “Once you’re born”

Questions: What is the best thing you read today?
Answers:
Today, I was changing t.v. channels , suddenly I saw him (gaur gopal prabhu).

Usually I never see or hear preaching but today his one sentence touched my heart .

Jb hum cocacola ki bottle ko hilate hai to wo bahar aa jati hai , par jb pani ki bottle ko hilate hai toh wo bahar nhi ati . ye log ye duniya tmhe hilayenge par yad rakho tum pani ho cocacola nhi .

(Translation : “when we shake cocacola bottle it suddenly spills off but when we shake water bottle it never spills out . This world , these people always will try to shake you but remember you are a water bottle not a cocacola.”)

It is your disability that you can't handle a situation.

I think those lines were pretty great .

Questions: What book are you reading now?
Answers:
My sister was struggling to get a job.

According to me, every girl should be independent. Every girl needs to earn their own money.

Girls don’t need to bear any domestic abuse just because she’s not earning. Girls should have a job so that they don’t become a burden to anyone at any point in life.

I told my father, strictly, that didi is not getting married unless she gets a job. Thankfully, this year she cleared a government exam and now she’s a Rural Agriculture Extention Officer. This is just the beginning for her, I hope, and she gets more in her life.

At that time, I came across a beautiful strong woman from Quora. I messaged her, personally, and thanked her as she was brave enough to share her story to motivate others.

I kept pushing my sister because of her. I wanted her to become as strong as that Quoran.

The moment didi’s results were out, I was so thankful to that Quoran. Because, like didi, she’s also like my elder sister. I wanted to dedicate an answer to her for a long time. But, I guess, this is the right time. She’s a published author now and I can’t be happier for her.

Anshu Di, I hope you stay blessed throughout your life and you’re strictly prohibited to leave this platform, okay?

I’m so excited to start your book right now.

We all are gifted,

Shubham KP

Questions: What interesting thing did you read today?
Answers:
“A mother tiger lost her cubs due to premature labour”.

She became depressed and her health declined.

But..

Zoologists wrapped piglets up in tiger-print cloth, and presented them to the mother tiger.

The tiger now loves these pigs & treats them like her babies.

Sweet, isn’t it ?

But when she'll realize, she will have a tender pork for dinner.
